title: Pregnant Maren Morris shares baby bump snap and reveals her son will be an Aries just like her
text:
Pregnant Maren Morris shared another b&w baby bump snap on Wednesday and revealed that her son - arriving in late March/early April - will be an Aries just like her.

The 29-year-old Grammy winner - who boasts 2.4M social media followers - tweeted: 'Got another Aries in the mix. uh oh!'

It will be the first child for Maren and her husband of 19 months, Ryan Hurd, who announced the gender of their baby on Tuesday.

got another Aries in the mix. uh oh. ♈️🔥 pic.twitter.com/B545xSVzcE — MAREN MORRIS (@MarenMorris) October 23, 2019

'We are very blessed and I feel like every month we have something to celebrate but keeping that one a secret was really hard,' the 32-year-old country crooner tweeted Wednesday.

'Can't wait to have a kid to play with. Homeboy already has his first few pairs of air max 90's and Michigan onesies.'

Morris and the Platonic singer originally met in 2013 when they co-wrote Tim McGraw's 2014 track Last Turn Home.

Look at her...can’t believe it. See you in March, baby! pic.twitter.com/sQZrFcJl18 — Ryan Hurd (@RyanHurd) October 22, 2019

Maren Morris' husband Ryan Hurd tweeted Wednesday: 'Can't wait to have a kid to play with. Homeboy already has his first few pairs of air max 90's and Michigan onesies'

Bump in the night! The 29-year-old Grammy winner first teased her baby news while clad in a blue-and-green sequined mini-dress during her concert Friday in Nashville

Parents-to-be! Morris and the 32-year-old country crooner originally met in 2013 when they co-wrote Tim McGraw's 2014 track Last Turn Home (pictured June 5)

The University of North Texas grad first teased her baby news while clad in a blue-and-green sequined mini-dress during her concert Friday in Nashville's Ascend Amphitheater.

The Bones songstress next bring her Girl Tour to Michigan's Stars and Strings festival at the Fox Theatre in Detroit on November 6.

Maren will then compete for six trophies - including album of the year - at the 53rd Annual Country Music Association Awards, which air November 13 on ABC.

Motherhood not slowing her down! The Bones songstress next bring her Girl Tour to Michigan's Stars and Strings festival at the Fox Theatre in Detroit on November 6
description: The 29-year-old Grammy winner and her husband Ryan Hurd will welcome their first child in late March/early April
